title: Combo Billing Calculator
description:
You are working for a food delivery app that offers combo meals to customers. Each combo has a fixed price. Write an R program that calculates the total bill for a given number of people based on their chosen combo. 
Combo Details: 
1 → Veg Combo: ₹200, 
2 → Non-Veg Combo: ₹300, 
3 → Premium Combo: ₹500. 
Task: Read combo and people as inputs and compute total bill. Display output as: ₹total.

title: Bookstore Billing System
description:
Scenario: You are developing a billing system for a bookstore. 
Customers choose a book type and quantity. 
Book Details: 
1 → Fiction: ₹150
2 → Non-Fiction: ₹200
3 → Academic: ₹300
Task: Read book type and quantity, compute total cost, and display as: ₹total.

title: Electricity Bill Estimator
description:
You are building a tool to estimate electricity bills. The rate per unit is ₹5. 
Task: Read number of units consumed and calculate total bill. 
Display as: ₹total.

title: Student Grade Evaluator
description:
You are designing a system to evaluate student grades. 
If marks ≥ 90 → Grade A, 75–89 → Grade B, 60–74 → Grade C, <60 → Grade D. 
Task: Read marks and display grade.

title: Simple Interest Calculator
description:
You are building a financial app that calculates simple interest. 
Formula: SI = (P × R × T)/100. 
Task: Read principal, rate, and time, and display SI as: ₹amount.

title: Temperature Converter
description:
You are designing a weather app that converts temperature from Celsius to Fahrenheit. 
Formula: F = (C × 9/5) + 32. 
Task: Read Celsius value and display Fahrenheit as: Fahrenheit: value.

title: Area of Rectangle
description:
You are building a geometry calculator. 
It should compute the area of a rectangle using length and breadth. 
Task: Read length and breadth and display area as: Area: value.

title: Parking Fee Calculator
description: A commercial parking lot charges customers based on the type of vehicle and the number of hours parked. The management wants a basic billing system that can take vehicle type and duration as input and compute the total parking fee. The rates are fixed for each vehicle category. The system should display the final fee to be collected from the customer.

title: Library Fine Calculator
description: A university library wants to automate its fine calculation system. Students are charged a fine based on the number of days a book is overdue. The fine rate is fixed per day. The system should accept the number of overdue days and return the total fine amount. This will be used to generate fine slips for students.

title: Mobile Data Usage Checker
description: A telecom provider wants to monitor user data consumption. Users input their daily usage for a week. The system should calculate total usage and determine if the user exceeded the weekly limit. It must handle zero usage days, mixed values, and display a clear status message.

title: Student Attendance Tracker
description: Scenario: A school administrator wants to track student attendance and determine eligibility for final exams. The rule is based on the percentage of classes attended. The system should accept total classes and attended classes as input and display whether the student is eligible or not. The eligibility criteria are predefined and must be strictly followed.

title: Exam Result Categorizer
description: An educational board wants to classify student results based on their final score. The classification must follow a strict grading scale. The system should accept the score and return the corresponding result category. This will be used to generate automated result sheets for schools.Exam Result Categorizer	Scenario: An educational board wants to classify student results based on their final score. The classification must follow a strict grading scale. The system should accept the score and return the corresponding result category. This will be used to generate automated result sheets for schools.

title: Tiered Tax Calculator
description: A government portal calculates income tax based on tiered slabs. Users input their annual income, and the system applies the correct tax rate based on predefined brackets. It must handle edge cases like zero income, boundary values, and return the final tax amount with proper formatting.

title: Electricity Bill Estimator
description: A utility company calculates monthly electricity bills based on units consumed. Slabs: ₹5/unit for first 100 units, ₹7/unit for next 100, ₹10/unit beyond 200. The system must compute total bill and handle zero usage, exact slab boundaries, and high consumption.

title: BMI Category Classifier
description: A health app calculates BMI and classifies it: Underweight (<18.5), Normal (18.5–24.9), Overweight (25–29.9), Obese (≥30). Users input weight (kg) and height (m). The system must compute BMI and return category. Must handle edge values and realistic ranges.

title: BMI Category Classifier
description: A health app calculates BMI and classifies it: Underweight (<18.5), Normal (18.5–24.9), Overweight (25–29.9), Obese (≥30). Users input weight (kg) and height (m). The system must compute BMI and return category. Must handle edge values and realistic ranges.

title: Loan EMI Calculator
description: A finance app calculates monthly EMI using formula: EMI = [P × R × (1+R)^N] / [(1+R)^N – 1], where P = principal, R = monthly interest rate, N = number of months. Users input P, annual rate %, and tenure in months. The system must convert annual rate to monthly, compute EMI, and round to 2 decimals.

title: Fitness Membership Billing
description: A gym offers membership packages based on duration and type of plan. Each plan has a fixed monthly rate. Customers choose a plan and specify the number of months they want to subscribe. The system should calculate the total membership fee and display it in a format suitable for invoice generation.

title: Compound Interest Calculator
description: A banking app calculates compound interest using formula: CI = P × [(1 + R/100)^T – 1]. Users input principal (P), rate (R), and time (T). System must compute CI and round to 2 decimals. Must handle zero values and large inputs.

title: Currency Converter
description: A travel app converts INR to foreign currencies. Rates: USD ₹83, EUR ₹90, GBP ₹105. Users input INR amount and target currency. System must validate currency and return converted amount rounded to 2 decimals.

title: Train Ticket Fare Calculator
description: A railway booking system calculates fare based on distance and class. Fare per km: Sleeper ₹1, AC ₹2.5, First Class ₹3. Users input distance and class. System must validate class, compute fare, and format output.

title: Parking Fee Calculator
description: A mall charges parking fees based on hours parked. Rules: ₹20/hour for first 5 hours, ₹50/hour beyond 5. Users input hours parked. System must compute total fee and handle edge cases.

title: Simple Interest Calculator
description: A banking app calculates simple interest using formula SI = (P × R × T)/100. Users input principal (P), rate (R), and time (T). The system must return interest amount and handle zero values, large inputs, and decimal rates.

title: Library Fine Calculator
description: A library charges fines for late returns. Rules: ₹0/day for first 5 days, ₹2/day for days 6–10, ₹5/day beyond 10. The system must calculate total fine based on days overdue and handle edge cases like exact boundaries and no delay.

title: Weekly Expense Analyzer
description: A budgeting app helps users track weekly expenses across seven days. Users input daily spending amounts, and the system calculates total, average, and identifies the highest and lowest spending days. It must handle zero entries, identical values, and mixed patterns, and return a summary report.

title: Circle Area Calculator
description: You are designing a math app that calculates the area of a circle. Formula: Area = π × r² (use π = 3.14). Task: Read radius and display area as: Area: value.

title: Leap Year Checker
description: You are building a calendar tool that checks whether a given year is a leap year. Rule: A year is a leap year if divisible by 4 but not by 100, unless also divisible by 400. Task: Read year and display result as: Leap Year or Not a Leap Year.

title: Water Usage Billing
description: A residential water board wants to implement a monthly billing system based on water consumption. Households report the number of liters used, and the system calculates the total bill based on a fixed rate per liter. The board requires the system to be simple and accurate, displaying the final bill amount clearly.

title: Water Usage Billing
description: A residential water board wants to implement a monthly billing system based on water consumption. Households report the number of liters used, and the system calculates the total bill based on a fixed rate per liter. The board requires the system to be simple and accurate, displaying the final bill amount clearly.
